member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.AggregationMethod
member.summary: This enumeration defines the aggregation method constants used to analyze the creation of data sets through event points.

summary.para: Calculate the appropriate grid size, create the grid surface data set, generate the grid surface data set with the point count of the surface grid unit and perform the hotspot analysis as the analysis field.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.ConceptualizationModel
member.summary: This enumeration defines the mode constants of spatial relations conceptualization. Also see PatternsParameter.

summary.para: The inverse distance model.
Any feature will influence the target feature. But the influence will decrease with the increase of distance. The feature weight is the one of the distance.
The inverse distance square model.
Similar to "inverse distance model", with the increase of distance, the influence is falling faster. The features weight are the one of the square distance.
The fixed distance model.
The features in the specified fixed distance range have the same weights (it is 1). Others will not influence the calculation (the weight is 0).
The indiscriminate zone model.

This model is the combination of the inverse distance model and fixed distance model. The elements in the fixed distance range have the same weight (1); Beyond the specified fixed distance range, the elements influence will decrease with the increase of distance
The region adjacency model.
Only the regions have contacts, it will influence the target elements (the weight is 1); otherwise, it will exclude to the target elements (the weight is 0).
The region adjacency model.
Only the regions have the contacts, it will influence the target elements (the weight is 1); otherwise, it will exclude to the target elements (the weight is 0).
K neighboring model.
The K elements near to the target element are contained in the calculation (the weight is 1). Others are excluded to the target element calculation (the weight is 0).
Provides the spatial weight matrix file.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.DistanceMethod
member.summary: This enumeration defines the distance calculation method constant. Also see MeasureParameter.

summary.para: Euclidean Distance. It calculates the straight-line distances.
The Manhattan distance. Calculate the sum of absolute values of two points x and y coordinates differences.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.EllipseSize
member.summary: The enumeration defines constant of the direction distribution output ellipse. See MeasureParameter.

summary.para: A standard deviation. The outputted elliptical semi-major axis and semi-minor axis is a times the corresponding standard deviation.

When the geometry objects have the space of normal distribution, that is, these geometry objects focus on the center and less toward the periphery; then the ellipses created by the EllipseSize.Single will contain 68% geometry objects.
Two standard deviations. The outputted elliptical semi-major axis and semi-minor axis is a times the corresponding standard deviation.

When the geometry objects have the space of normal distribution, that is, these geometry objects focus on the center and less toward the periphery; then the ellipses created by the EllipseSize.Twice will contain 95% geometry objects.
Three standard deviations. The outputted elliptical semi-major axis and semi-minor axis is a times the corresponding standard deviation.

When the geometry objects have the space of normal distribution, that is, these geometry objects focus on the center and less toward the periphery; then the ellipses created by the EllipseSize.Triple will contain 99% geometry objects.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.KernelFunction
member.summary: This enumeration defines the geographically weighted regression analysis kernel function type constants. Please refer to the GWRParameter.

summary.para: The Gaussian kernel function.
The calculation formula of the Gaussian kernel function:
The W_ij is the weight between the point i and j. d_ij is the distance between the point i and j. b is the bandwidth range.
The quadratic function.
The calculation formula of the quadratic function:
If d_ij≤b, W_ij=(1-(d_ij/b)^2))^2; otherwise, W_ij=0.
The W_ij is the weight between the point i and j. d_ij is the distance between the point i and j. b is the bandwidth range.
The box kernel function.
The calculation formula of the box kernel function:
If d_ij≤b, W_ij=1; otherwise, W_ij=0.
The W_ij is the weight between the point i and j. d_ij is the distance between the point i and j. b is the bandwidth range.
The cube kernel function.
The calculation formula of the cube kernel function:
If d_ij≤b, W_ij=(1-(d_ij/b)^3))^3; otherwise, W_ij=0.
The W_ij is the weight between the point i and j. d_ij is the distance between the point i and j. b is the bandwidth range.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.KernelType
member.summary: This enumeration defines the geographically weighted regression analysis bandwidth type constants. Please refer to the GWRParameter.

summary.para: The fixed bandwidth. For each regression analysis points, use a fixed value as the bandwidth range.
Flexible bandwidth. For each regression analysis point, use the distance between the regression point and the K nearest point as the bandwidth. K is the adjacent number.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.#ctor(SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the patternsParameter class which is identical with the specified patternsParameter object.
member.param: The specified patternsParameter object.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.AssessmentFieldName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the evaluation field.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.ConceptModel
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial relations conceptual model.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.DistanceTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the break distance tolerance.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.Exponent
member.summary: Gets or sets the inverse distance power exponent.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.Neighbors
member.summary: Gets or sets the adjacent number.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.IsStandardization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to standardize the spatial weight matrix.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.SelfWeightField
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the weight field.
member.value: The default value is String.Empty, i.e., there are no self weight fields.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.IsFDRAdjusted
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to conduct the FDR correction.
member.value: The default value is false. That is, do not conduct the FDR correction.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.FilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the spatial weight matrix file path.
member.value: The default value is String.Empty, that is, no spatial weight matrix file.

member.name: P:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter.DistanceMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets distance measure method type.
member.value: The default is DistanceMethod.Euclidean, namely, the euclidean distance.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure
member.summary: The spatial measurement class. This class can calculate the values that represents the distribution through measuring a group of data, such as the data center, direction and so on.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure.MeasureMeanCenter(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.MeasureParameter)
member.summary: Calculates the average center of the vector data, and returns the result vector dataset.
member.param: The specified datasets to be calculated which can be point, line and region datasets.
Datasource for storing the output datasets.
The specified name of the result dataset.
The specified spatial measure parameter settings.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure.MeasureMedianCenter(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.MeasureParameter)
member.summary: Calculates the median center of the vector data, and returns the result vector dataset.
member.param: The specified datasets to be calculated which can be point, line and region datasets.
Datasource for storing the output datasets.
The specified name of the result dataset.
The specified spatial measure parameter settings.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure.MeasureCentralElement(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.MeasureParameter)
member.summary: Calculates the center feature of the vector data, and return the result vector dataset.
member.param: The specified datasets to be calculated which can be point, line and region datasets.
Datasource for storing the output datasets.
The specified name of the result dataset.
The specified spatial measure parameter settings.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure.MeasureDirection(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.MeasureParameter)
member.summary: Calculates the direction distribution of the vector data, and return the result vector dataset.
member.param: The specified datasets to be calculated which can be point, line and region datasets.
Datasource for storing the output datasets.
The specified name of the result dataset.
The specified spatial measure parameter settings.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure.MeasureStandardDistance(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.MeasureParameter)
member.summary: Calculate the standard distance of vector data and return the result vector data set.
member.param: Specifies the data set to be computed.Can be point, line, face data set.
Specifies the data source for storing the result data set.
The name of the result dataset specified.
The specified spatial metric parameter settings.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure.MeasureLinearDirectionalMean(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.MeasureParameter)
member.summary: Calculate the direction average of the line data set and return the result vector data set.
member.param: Specifies the data set to be computed.Is a line data set.
Specifies the data source for storing the result data set.
The name of the result dataset specified.
The specified spatial metric parameter settings.

member.name: E:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialMeasure.Stepped
member.summary: The event is trigged when the process bar is activated.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialRelModeling
member.summary: The spatial relation modeling class. This class can establish the spatial relation model by using the regression analysis.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialRelModeling.GeographicWeightedRegression(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.GWRParameter)
member.summary: The geographically weighted regression analysis.
member.param: The specified datasets to be calculated which can be point, line and region datasets.
Datasource for storing the output datasets.
The specified name of the result dataset.
The specified geographically weight regression analysis parameter settings.
member.returns: The result info of the geographically weighted regression analysis.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialRelModeling.OrdinaryLeastSquares(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.OLSParameter)
member.summary: Ordinary least squares method.
member.param: Specified data set to be calculated. Can be point, line, and polygon datasets.
Specified data source for storing the result dataset.
The specified result data set name.
Specified normal least squares parameter setting.

member.name: E:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.SpatialRelModeling.Stepped
member.summary: The event is trigged when the process bar is activated.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType
member.summary: This enumeration defines the constants of the field statistics type after the dataset is spatial measured.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType.Max
member.summary: The maximum of the statistics field. Only numeric type is supported.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType.Min
member.summary: The minimum of the statistics field. Only numeric type is supported.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType.Sum
member.summary: The sum of the statistics field. Only numeric type is supported.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType.Mean
member.summary: The mean of the statistics field. Only numeric type is supported.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType.First
member.summary: Retains the field value of the first object. The types of numeric, date, boolean and text are supported.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType.Last
member.summary: Retains the field value of the last object. The types of numeric, date, boolean and text are supported.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsType.Median
member.summary: The median of the statistics fields.Only valid for numeric fields.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsUtilities
member.summary: Spatial statistical analysis tool class.This class can be used for simple processing of data.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.StatisticsUtilities.CollectEvents(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String)
member.summary: Collect events to convert event data into weighted data.
member.param: The specified collection of data to be collected.Can be point, line, face data set。
Specifies the data source for storing the result point data set.
The specified result point data set name.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.WeightsUtilities
member.summary: The spatial weight matrix tool class. This class is used to construct the spatial weight matrix.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.WeightsUtilities.BuildWeightMatrix(SuperMap.Data.DatasetVector,System.String,System.String,SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.PatternsParameter)
member.summary: Constructs the spatial weight matrix.
member.param: Specifies source dataset.
The specified unique ID field name.
The save path of the specified spatial weight matrix file.
Parameter settings for the specified analysis mode.
member.returns: A boolean represents whether to construct the spatial weight matrix. Returns true if successful, otherwise false.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.WeightsUtilities.ConverToTableDataset(System.String,SuperMap.Data.Datasource,System.String)
member.summary: Converts the spatial weight matrix files to the attribute tables.
member.param: The specified path of the spatial weight matrix file.
Datasource for storing the output attribute table.
The name of the specified result tabular name.

member.name: E:SuperMap.Analyst.SpatialStatistics.WeightsUtilities.Stepped
member.summary: The event is trigged when the process bar is activated.
